abstract: A new tally of its board of directors’ election shows that five Yahoo directors, including the chief executive, Jerry Yang, were re-elected with much higher protest votes than initially released.
snippet: A new tally of its board of directors’ election shows that five Yahoo directors, including the chief executive, Jerry Yang, were re-elected with much higher protest votes than initially released.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Five Yahoo directors, including Jerry Yang, the chief executive, were re-elected to the board with much higher protest votes than previously reported, indicating strong shareholder dissatisfaction with the company’s performance and its failed merger negotiations with Microsoft.

headline.main: Revised Tally Increases ‘No’ Votes for Yahoo Directors
headline.print_headline: Revised Tally Increases ‘No’ Votes for Yahoo Directors

abstract: A group, including Microsoft, has launched an initiative to distribute free software to personal computer owners to help them save on energy costs.
snippet: A group, including Microsoft, has launched an initiative to distribute free software to personal computer owners to help them save on energy costs.
lead_paragraph: In its drive to go green, the technology industry has so far focused mainly on big targets like corporations and especially computer data centers, the power-hungry computing engine rooms of the Internet economy.

headline.main: An Energy Diet for Power-Hungry Household PCs
headline.print_headline: An Energy Diet for Power-Hungry Household PCs

abstract: Five Yahoo directors, including Jerry Yang, the chief executive, were re-elected to the board with much higher protest votes than previously reported, indicating strong shareholder dissatisfaction with the company’s performance and its failed merger negotiations with Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: Five Yahoo directors, including Jerry Yang, the chief executive, were re-elected to the board with much higher protest votes than previously reported, indicating strong shareholder dissatisfaction with the company’s performance and its failed merger negotiations with Microsoft.

headline.main: Revised Tally Increases ‘No’ Votes for Yahoo Directors

abstract: You can conserve paper by saving receipts from Web purchases as PDF files instead of printing them.
snippet: You can conserve paper by saving receipts from Web purchases as PDF files instead of printing them.
lead_paragraph: You can conserve paper by saving receipts from Web purchases as PDF files instead of printing them. A free program, CutePDF, converts an onscreen Web receipt to a PDF file by just using the Print command and choosing “CutePDF Writer” as the printer. The program and a required helper script are both available at www.cutepdf.com and there are other similar programs around the Web; Microsoft has a free PDF add-on for Office 2007 at snipurl.com/3aqxp. In the Mac OS X Print dialog box, click the PDF button to see your PDF options  including a “Save PDF File to Web Receipts Folder” command.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Conserving Paper
